703754f-b.title: Brooklyn: Columbia Street - Lorraine Street
703754f-b.text:
Columbia Street, north from Lorraine Street, showing at the
left foreground Todd's Field. Beyond it is seen the American Can
Co's buildings on Werona and Dwight Streets. View No. 2 shows homes
on the north side of Bush Street ard also on Dvight Street. In the
far background is also seen several skyscrapers of Manhattan.
June 9, 1938
Views 1 and 2
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIO:S.
703754f-b.folder: Columbia Street & Lorraine Street, Brooklyn, NY

705500f-b.title: Brooklyn: Lorraine Street - Columbia Street
705500f-b.text:
Lorraine Street, east from Columbia Street. The
buildings on the north side of the street were later
razed to make way for the low rent Red Hook Housing
Project sponsored by the New York City Housing Authority.
Views 2 and 3 show the new housing center under con-
struction.
View 1: June 9, 1938
View 2: April 9, 1939
View 3: October 21, 1939
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
705500f-b.folder: Lorraine Street & Columbia Street, Brooklyn, NY

703753f-a.title: Brooklyn: Columbia Street - Lorraine Street
703753f-a.text:
(1)
Columbia Street, north from Lorraine Street. This view
shows the buildings on the east side of the street, bearing numbers
519 to 499 and extending to Bush Street. The houses were razed
several years later to make wa for the New York City Housing
Authorityts Red Hook low-rent housing project.
July 11, 1932
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
(2)
The housing center under construction, viewing north on
Columbia Street from Lorraine Street.
April 9, 1939
P. L. Sperr
NO REIRODUCTIONS

703752f-a.title: Brooklyn: Columbia Street - Lorraine Street
703752f-a.folder: Columbia Street & Lorraine Street, Brooklyn, NY

705501f-b.title: Brooklyn: Lorraine Street - Columbia Street
705501f-b.text:
6l to 73 Lorraine Street, north side, between Columbis
and Hicks Streets, viewing northeastward across the S. E. corner
of Lorraine and Columbia Streets and shwwing several old houses
that were later razed to make way for the erection of the Red Hook
low cost housing development, sponsored by the New Yorl City Hous-
ing Authority.
Views 2 and 3 show number 71-73.
Views 1,2: June 25, 1931
Vie- 3: 1938
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODTTIONS
